results.title: There's no business like show business
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Sol Siegel and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: An all-star cast that includes Ethel Merman, Dan Dailey, Marilyn Monroe, Donald O’Connor, Johnnie Ray and Mitzi Gaynor, sparks this tuneful Irving Berlin musical depicting the trials and triumphs of a veteran vaudeville family. Molly and Terry Donahue start out as a duo and keep adding kids to their stage act until they finally become the 5 Donahues. Their busy, sometimes tumultuous lives aren’t always easy, but the Donahues have plenty of love to get them through the hard times and more than enough talent to keep them on top. Highlighted by one classic Irving Berlin song after another and an array of dazzling production numbers, this upbeat, utterly delightful tale of life on the stage proves, beyond any doubt that there is no business like show business!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Sol Siegel and Walter Lang

results.title: Theorem = Teorema
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Franco Rossellini, Manolo Bolognini and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: The story is simple - a mysterious stranger (Terence Stamp) arrives at a bourgeois household in Milan and successively seduces the son (Andres Jose Cruz), the mother (Silvana Magnano), the daughter (Anne Wiazemsky) and the father (Massimo Girotti), not forgetting the maid (Laura Betti). As a result of his attentions, the father hands over his factory to the workers, the son abandons his vocation as a painter, the mother gives herself over to random sexual encounters and the daughter sinks into catatonia while the maid becomes a saint. Pasolini uses his schematic plot to prove a point (the bourgeois family is held together by sexual repression) and to explore family dynamics, the intersection of class and sex, and the nature of different sexualities. He also delves into the ‘trouble’ caused by homosexuality. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Them!
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David Weisbart and Gordon Douglas
results.brief_description: Man split the atom to create the ultimate weapon not realising he would also create Them! The terror begins in the New Mexico desert when a patrolman (James Whitmore) discovers a ransacked General Store with the cash drawers untouched, the sugar supply missing and a battered corpse containing enough formic acid to kill 20 men. An FBI official and a fuddy-duddy entomologist (Edmund Gwenn) attempt to unravel the mystery. What they discover strikes terror from coast to coast: man’s atomic testing has spawned rampaging hordes of giant radiation-mutated ants, 12 feet long and capable of lifting tons. These mutants bypass the larval stage and come directly from the egg - ready to kill. In an epic death struggle, the formidable formicidae are trapped in the 700-mile storm drain network beneath fear-stricken Los Angeles and eventually beaten. A generation of films about radioactive creatures have approximated the terror but none have equalled the artistry of Them! with Academy Award nominated special effects (1954). Co-starring Joan Weldon, James Arness and Onslow Stevens. Fess Parker has a small but memorable role and look quickly for Leonard Nimoy at a teletype machine.

results.title: Thelma and Louise [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Ridley Scott and Mimi Polk
results.brief_description: Fasten your seatbelts as two of Hollywood’s hottest women rev it up and take it on the road. When unhappy housewife Thelma (Geena Davis) and her wisecracking friend Louise (Susan Sarandon) decide to take a break from their lives, they embark on a trip that leads to a tragic incident at a roadside honky tonk. In an instant, their weekend “getaway” becomes just that as they flee across the American southwest with the police one step behind. A classic twist on the usual “buddy-outlaw” movie, where men are most often the unlikely heroes, this film has a charming, refreshing and triumphant outlook. Cast also includes Harvey Keitel.

results.title: The Yearling
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sidney A. Franklin and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: The Yearling is a story of the Baxter family and their struggle to maintain their small farm. Jody, a twelve year old boy, yearns for a pet with whom he can share the last carefree days of his childhood. He adopts an orphaned fawn but their joyous times are tempered when the fawn grows into a yearling and becomes a threat to the family’s meagre crops. Based on Marjorie Kinnen Rawlings’ acclaimed novel.

results.title: The Year of living dangerously
results.creator_credit: McElroy & McElroy, Jim McElroy and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Set in Indonesia during the 1965 civil strife, this adaptation of the of the novel by C.J. Koch, concentrates on a small group of journalists in Jakarta, who are covering the crisis, and the strange three-way relationship between an Australian correspondent, his extraordinary Chinese-Australian cameraman and the woman they both love.

results.title: The Wrong Man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Herbert Coleman and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A tense thriller based on the true story of an honest man mistaken for an armed robber. When Christopher Balestrero (Henry Fonda) decides to borrow money on his wife’s insurance policy to pay urgent debts, a tragic chain of events is set off because the staff of the insurance company believe him to be a man who previously held up their office.

results.title: The World according to Garp
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, George Roy Hill and Robert L. Crawford
results.brief_description: This film version of John Irving’s novel “The World According to Garp” brilliantly captures the quirky spirit of the original story. T.S. Garp is the illegitimate child of unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields. Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp’s outlook on life crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother achieves fame through the publishing of her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Garp remains envious of his fearless mother. Cast includes: Robin Williams, Mary Beth Hurt, Glenn Close and John Lithgow.

results.title: The Woman in the window
results.creator_credit: The Christie Corporation, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Nunnally Johnson and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: In this film noir, one man’s life is turned upside down by an encounter with a stranger. Professor Richard Wanley (Edward G. Robinson), an academic reduced to summer batchelorhood accepts a beautiful woman’s (Joan Bennett) offer of a drink - only to find himself an inadvertent murderer and a pawn in a dreadful roundelay of deception, blackmail, sudden death and suicide. Director Fritz Lang keeps the tension taut, New York sidewalks glistening and the audience guessing. ‘The Woman in the Window’ shows that good and evil are present in all, and that circumstances frequently dictate moral choices. So successful was this movie that Robinson, Lang, leading lady Joan Bennet and baddie Dan Duryea immediately reteamed for ‘Sacrlett Street’. Screenplay by Nunnaly Johnson from the novel ‘Once off guard’ by J. H. Wallis.
